workflow.name: Automate GST/VAT tax returns with OpenAI, Gmail and government portal integration
workflow.description:
## How It Works
Automates financial aggregation, validation, and intelligent tax assessment. Integrates revenue, expenses, and invoices via scheduled connectors, merges data into unified records, and applies AI-driven analysis for anomaly detection and tax calculations. The system evaluates tax liability against configurable thresholds, intelligently routes filings to government portals or tax agents based on jurisdiction rules, and triggers automated email notifications for compliance deadlines and payment reminders. Designed for accountants, small business owners, and finance teams managing quarterly tax obligations while minimizing manual errors and compliance risks across multiple entities.

## Setup Steps
1. Configure OpenAI, Gmail, and Google Sheets credentials
2. Connect revenue and expense data sources
3. Define tax thresholds and jurisdiction-specific rules in workflow nodes
4. Map output fields to government or tax agent systems
5. Create email templates for notifications
6. Test the workflow with sample financial data before enabling

## Prerequisites
OpenAI API key, Gmail account, Google Sheets, accounting software or data source connectivity 

## Use Cases
Quarterly tax filing automation, multi-client accountant workflows, enterprise compliance monitoring 

## Customization
Adjust tax thresholds by jurisdiction, integrate additional data sources 

## Benefits
Significant reduction in calculation errors, faster filing timelines, automated deadline alerts

workflow.name: Automated GST/VAT Tax Return Preparation and Submission System

parameters.text: =Analyze the following financial data and calculate GST/VAT tax: {{ JSON.stringify($json) }}

options.systemMessage:
You are a tax calculation specialist AI agent.

Your task is to:
1. Review all revenue, expenses, and invoice transactions
2. Validate whether each transaction is taxable based on standard GST/VAT rules
3. Calculate the total taxable revenue and expenses
4. Calculate the GST/VAT amounts using the provided tax rate
5. Determine the net tax owed or refund due
6. Return structured results in JSON format

Rules:
- Exempt items: basic food, medical services, education, financial services
- Zero-rated items: exports, international services
- Standard-rated: all other goods and services
- Use the Calculator tool for all arithmetic operations

Return your analysis with clear categorization of taxable vs non-taxable items.

parameters.message:
=

Tax Return Declaration

Please find attached the tax return declaration for {{ $now.format('MMMM yyyy') }}.

{{ JSON.stringify($json, null, 2) }}
parameters.subject: =Tax Return Declaration - {{ $now.format('MMMM yyyy') }}

assignments.name: submissionMethod
assignments.value: ={{ $('Submit to Government Portal').itemMatched ? 'Government Portal' : 'Tax Agent Email' }}

parameters.message:
=

Tax Payment Reminder

Your tax return has been submitted successfully.

Amount Owed: ${{ $json.netTaxOwed.toFixed(2) }}

Confirmation Code: {{ $json.confirmationCode }}

Please arrange payment by the due date to avoid penalties.
parameters.subject: =Payment Reminder: Tax Owed for {{ $now.format('MMMM yyyy') }}

assignments.name: message
assignments.value: No tax payment required - refund or zero balance

assignments.name: message
assignments.value: Revenue below filing threshold - no tax return required

parameters.content:
## Customization
Adjust tax thresholds by jurisdiction, integrate additional data sources 

## Benefits
Significant reduction in calculation errors, faster filing timelines, automated deadline alerts

## Prerequisites
OpenAI API key, Gmail account, Google Sheets, accounting software or data source connectivity 

## Use Cases
Quarterly tax filing automation, multi-client accountant workflows, enterprise compliance monitoring

## Setup Steps
1. Configure OpenAI, Gmail, and Google Sheets credentials
2. Connect revenue and expense data sources
3. Define tax thresholds and jurisdiction 
4. Map output fields to government or tax agent systems
5. Create email templates for notifications

## How It Works
Automates financial aggregation, validation, and intelligent tax assessment. Integrates revenue, expenses, and invoices via scheduled connectors, merges data into unified records, and applies AI-driven analysis for anomaly detection and tax calculations. The system evaluates tax liability against configurable thresholds, intelligently routes filings to government portals or tax agents based on jurisdiction rules, and triggers automated email notifications for compliance deadlines and payment reminders. Designed for accountants, small business owners, and finance teams managing quarterly tax obligations while minimizing manual errors and compliance risks across multiple entities.

## Data Collection 
‚Äì Fetches revenue, expenses, and invoice data from source systems weekly
**Why:** Ensures current financial information for accurate tax calculations

## AI Validation 
‚Äì OpenAI processes financials, extracts metrics, and identifies anomalies
**Why:** Catches errors and ensures accurate obligation determination

## Threshold Checking & Routing
‚Äì Compares calculated liability against predefined rules
**Why:** Identifies filing requirements and special circumstances

## Automated Communication 
‚Äì Sends notices and reminders via email
**Why:** Maintains deadline compliance and payment timeliness

user.name: Cheng Siong Chin
user.bio: Dr. Cheng Siong CHIN is an n8n workflow creator specializing in AI-powered automation, agent orchestration, and intelligent system integrations. He designs and builds end-to-end workflows that combine LLMs, APIs, and data pipelines to streamline complex processes and deliver production-ready automation solutions. Contact me to discuss custom AI workflows and agent architectures.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
